intro: Lessingia germanorum var. vallicola, commonly known as the valley lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and meadows. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is typically found in regions with well-drained soils.
